subject: Sexual Health
title: Sperm Production
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Sperm Production.

hook.text: It takes about 74 days to produce a single mature sperm cell from start to finish.

buildup.text: Inside the testes, tiny coiled tubes called seminiferous tubules serve as sperm factories.

discovery.text: Stem cells divide and mature through several stages until they become fully formed spermatozoa.

twist.text: Despite producing millions daily, each sperm carries a unique combination of the father's genes.

climax.text: The production line runs nonstop from puberty onward, never taking a single day off.

punchline.text: A factory that never closes, running for decades.

quiz.question: How long does it take to produce one mature sperm?
